newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada July wage settlements average 0.7 pct rise.
newsitem.headline: Canada July wage settlements average 0.7 pct rise.

text.p: Annual wage increases in Canadian collective bargaining agreements reached in July averaged 0.7 percent, up from 0.5 percent in June, the Department of Human Resources Development said on Tuesday.
A Reuters survey of economists had forecast a 0.8 percent increase in wage settlements in July.

Wage increases are the average annual percentage increase in base rates -- the wage rate of the lowest paid classification in a bargaining unit -- over the term of the agreement in settlements negotiated during the period shown.
(For more information on the settlements, contact Human Resources Development's Workplace Information Directorate, at 1-800-567-6866 or 819-997-3117.)
